XI.ii.3.E.11.e
.
Cases in Which the Estate Is the Claimant
If one of the co-executors or co-administrators of an estate files a claim, any award to the estate must be payable to all of the co-executors or co-administrators as appointed by the court.
A formal application on
VA Form 21P-601
must be filed, supported by a certified copy of the letters of administration or letters testamentary bearing the signature and seal of the appointing court.
Note
:  Consider the claimant the sole executor unless there is evidence that there are other executors.
Reference
:  For more information on claims involving political subdivisions, see
M21-1, Part XI, Subpart ii, 3.E.13
.
